entry.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
entry.summary: Tom, MuSig2 requires multiple `R` points from signatories, unlike MuSig1. These points are aggregated using the MuSig() public key compose function. This prevents party 2 from creating an `R` that could allow certain attacks. MuSig1 requires 3 round trips, while MuSig2 requires at least 2 `R` nonces per signatory. Your scheme has only one `R` per party, making it vulnerable to that attack.Regards,ZmnSCPxj
